Description: Shoulder sherd (with turn of neck) of East Greek black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: wide black band with row of dots in added white at top of shoulder; below, black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx and cock (head of sphinx, with hair in added white, to right, and forepart of cock to left remaining); part of large incised blob rosette as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sphinx has a distinctly Chian appearance.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1210)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
